profiles.name: ssh
profiles.title: Basic SSH
profiles.summary: Verify that SSH Server and SSH Client are configured securely

controls.title: /etc/ssh should be a directory
controls.desc:
In order for OpenSSH to function correctly, its
configuration path must be a folder.
controls.code:
control 'basic-1' do
  impact 1.0
  title '/etc/ssh should be a directory'
  desc '
    In order for OpenSSH to function correctly, its
    configuration path must be a folder.
  '
  describe file('/etc/ssh') do
    it { should be_directory }
  end
end

controls.title: /etc/ssh should be owned by root
controls.desc:
The OpenSSH configuration folder should be owned
by the root user. It is an important step towards making
sure, that configuration files are only changed by
priviledged users.
controls.code:
control 'basic-2' do
  impact 1.0
  title '/etc/ssh should be owned by root'
  desc '
    The OpenSSH configuration folder should be owned
    by the root user. It is an important step towards making
    sure, that configuration files are only changed by
    priviledged users.
  '
  describe file('/etc/ssh') do
    it { should be_owned_by 'root' }
  end
end

controls.title: /etc/ssh should have limited access to 0755
controls.desc:
The OpenSSH configuration folder should have restricted
access permissions. It is an important step towards making
sure, that configuration files are only changed by
priviledged users, while leaving them readable for the
SSH client.
controls.code:
control 'basic-3' do
  impact 0.5
  title '/etc/ssh should have limited access to 0755'
  desc '
    The OpenSSH configuration folder should have restricted
    access permissions. It is an important step towards making
    sure, that configuration files are only changed by
    priviledged users, while leaving them readable for the
    SSH client.
  '
  describe file('/etc/ssh') do
    it { should_not be_writable.by('group') }
    it { should_not be_writable.by('others') }
    it { should_not be_readable.by('others') }
  end
end

results.code_desc: File /etc/ssh should not be writable by group
File /etc/ssh should not be writable by others
File /etc/ssh should not be readable by others
results.message: expected File /etc/ssh not to be readable by others

controls.title: ssh_config should have restricted access to 0644
controls.desc:
The system-wide client ssh configuration file
should only be modified by its owner (root).
controls.code:
control 'basic-6' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'ssh_config should have restricted access to 0644'
  desc '
    The system-wide client ssh configuration file
    should only be modified by its owner (root).
  '
  describe file('/etc/ssh/ssh_config') do
    it { should be_mode 0o644 }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Configure address family
controls.desc:
OpenSSH should be configured to the network family.
Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it
to inet6.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-1' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Client: Configure address family'
  desc '
    OpenSSH should be configured to the network family.
    Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it
    to inet6.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('AddressFamily') { should match(/inet|any/) }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Configure expected port
controls.desc:
Configure the port which you expect your SSH client to
connect to.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-3' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Client: Configure expected port'
  desc '
    Configure the port which you expect your SSH client to
    connect to.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('Port') { should eq('22') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Set SSH protocol version to 2
controls.desc:
Set the SSH protocol version to 2. Don't use legacy
insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-4' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Client: Set SSH protocol version to 2'
  desc "
    Set the SSH protocol version to 2. Don't use legacy
    insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.
  "
  describe ssh_config do
    its('Protocol') { should eq('2') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Disable batch mode
controls.desc: Avoid batch mode in the default configuration.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-5' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Client: Disable batch mode'
  desc '
    Avoid batch mode in the default configuration.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('BatchMode') { should eq('no') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Check Host IPs
controls.desc:
Make sure that SSH checks the host IP address in the
known_hosts file, to avoid DNS spoofing effects.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-6' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Client: Check Host IPs'
  desc '
    Make sure that SSH checks the host IP address in the
    known_hosts file, to avoid DNS spoofing effects.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('CheckHostIP') { should eq('yes') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Ask when checking host keys
controls.desc:
Don't automatically add new host keys to the list of
known hosts.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-7' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Client: Ask when checking host keys'
  desc "
    Don't automatically add new host keys to the list of
    known hosts.
  "
  describe ssh_config do
    its('StrictHostKeyChecking') { should match(/ask|yes/) }
  end
end

    its('Ciphers') { should match(ssh_crypto.valid_ciphers) }

end

controls.desc:
Prevent agent forwarding by default, as it can

  title 'Client: Disable agent forwarding'

controls.desc:

controls.title: Client: Enable RSA authentication

controls.title: Client: Disable password-based authentication
controls.desc:
Avoid all password-based authentications. They are
often weaker than key-based authentication and may enable

control 'ssh-16' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Client: Disable password-based authentication'
  desc '
    Avoid all password-based authentications. They are
    often weaker than key-based authentication and may enable
    weak passwords to enter a system.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('PasswordAuthentication') { should eq('no') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Disable tunnels
controls.desc: Avoid using SSH tunnels.
controls.code:
control 'ssh-19' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Client: Disable tunnels'
  desc '
    Avoid using SSH tunnels.
  '
  describe ssh_config do
    its('Tunnel') { should eq('no') }
  end
end

controls.title: Client: Do not permit local commands
controls.desc: Do not permit any local command execution.

control 'ssh-20' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Client: Do not permit local commands'

controls.title: sshd_config should be owned by root
controls.desc:
The SSH server configuration file
should only be modified by its owner (root).
controls.code:
control 'basic-4' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'sshd_config should be owned by root'
  desc '
    The SSH server configuration file
    should only be modified by its owner (root).
  '
  describe file('/etc/ssh/sshd_config') do
    it { should be_owned_by 'root' }
    it { should be_grouped_into 'root' }
  end
end

results.message: expected `File /etc/ssh/sshd_config.grouped_into?("root")` to return true, got false

controls.title: sshd_config should not be group-writable/executable

The SSH server configuration file

  impact 0.5
  title 'sshd_config should not be group-writable/executable'

    it { should_not be_executable.by('owner') }
  end
end

results.code_desc: File /etc/ssh/sshd_config should not be executable by owner

controls.title: Server: Do not permit root-based login
controls.desc:
To reduce the potential to gain full privileges
of a system in the course of one attack (by either misconfiguration
or vulnerabilities), do not allow logging in as the root user.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-7' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Server: Do not permit root-based login'
  desc '
    To reduce the potential to gain full privileges
    of a system in the course of one attack (by either misconfiguration
    or vulnerabilities), do not allow logging in as the root user.
  '
  describe sshd_config do
    its('PermitRootLogin') { should match(/no|without-password/) }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Configure the service port
controls.desc:
Always specify which port the SSH server should listen to.
Prevent unexpected settings.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-8' do
  impact 0.6
  title 'Server: Configure the service port'
  desc '
    Always specify which port the SSH server should listen to.
    Prevent unexpected settings.
  '
  describe sshd_config do
    its('Port') { should eq('22') }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Specify a valid address family
controls.desc:
OpenSSH should be configured to the network family.
Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it
to inet6.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-9' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Server: Specify a valid address family'
  desc '
    OpenSSH should be configured to the network family.
    Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it
    to inet6.
  '
  describe sshd_config do
    its('AddressFamily') { should match(/inet|any/) }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Configure a listen address
controls.desc:
Limit the SSH server to listen to a specific
address. Don't let it listen on all interfaces to avoid
logins from unexpected sources.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-10' do
  impact 0.6
  title 'Server: Configure a listen address'
  desc "
    Limit the SSH server to listen to a specific
    address. Don't let it listen on all interfaces to avoid
    logins from unexpected sources.
  "
  describe sshd_config do
    its('ListenAddress') { should_not eq('0.0.0.0') }
    its('ListenAddress') { should_not eq('::') }
    its('ListenAddress') { should_not eq(nil) }
  end
end

results.code_desc: SSHD Configuration ListenAddress should not eq "0.0.0.0"
SSHD Configuration ListenAddress should not eq "::"
SSHD Configuration ListenAddress should not eq nil
results.message:
expected: value != nil
     got: nil

(compared using ==)

controls.title: Server: Set protocol version to SSHv2
controls.desc:
Set the SSH protocol version to 2. Don't use legacy
insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-11' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Server: Set protocol version to SSHv2'

    its('Protocol') { should eq('2') }

end

controls.title: Server: Enable strict mode
controls.desc:
Verify file modes and ownerships before accepting a
user's login. Prevent misconfiguration of novice users.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-12' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Server: Enable strict mode'
  desc "
    Verify file modes and ownerships before accepting a
    user's login. Prevent misconfiguration of novice users.
  "
  describe sshd_config do
    its('StrictModes') { should eq('yes') }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Enable verbose logging
controls.desc:
Be verbose in logging, to allow analysis in case
of unexpected behavior.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-14.1' do
  impact 0.1
  title 'Server: Enable verbose logging'
  desc '
    Be verbose in logging, to allow analysis in case
    of unexpected behavior.
  '
  describe sshd_config do
    its('LogLevel') { should match(/VERBOSE|DEBUG/) }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Set the minimum log level to info
controls.desc:
Don't reduce logs below info level, to gain
all necessary information for later analysis.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-14.2' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Set the minimum log level to info'
  desc "
    Don't reduce logs below info level, to gain
    all necessary information for later analysis.
  "
  describe sshd_config do
    its('LogLevel') { should match(/INFO|VERBOSE|DEBUG/) }
  end
end

controls.title: Server: Disable legacy login mechanism
controls.desc: Do not use login for interactive login sessions.
controls.code:

  desc '

incoming network traffic, to avoid privilege escalation

control 'sshd-19' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Use priviledge separation'

    its('UsePrivilegeSeparation') { should eq('yes') }
  end

controls.desc:
Do not enable custom user environments. They may be used

control 'sshd-20' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Disable users loading their environment variables'

controls.title: Server: Limit maximum auth retries

controls.title: Server: Limit maximum user sessions to 10

Limit the maximum number of user sessions to a reasonable

  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Limit maximum user sessions to 10'

controls.title: Server: Disable Kerberos or Local Password (due to the password part)
controls.desc:
Avoid password-based authentication, which is used as a fallback
when Kerberos fails in this setting.
controls.code:
control 'sshd-34' do
  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Disable Kerberos or Local Password (due to the password part)'
  desc '
    Avoid password-based authentication, which is used as a fallback
    when Kerberos fails in this setting.
  '
  describe sshd_config do
    its('KerberosOrLocalPasswd') { should eq('no') }
  end
end

Use ClientAlive messages which are sent over the encrypted
channel and aren't spoofable to see if the client is still alive.

  impact 0.5
  title 'Server: Disable TCP KeepAlive'

  "

Use ClientAlive messages which are sent over the encrypted

Use ClientAlive messages which are sent over the encrypted
channel and aren't spoofable to see if the client is still alive.

profiles.name: acme-inspec-profile
profiles.title: Meta profile for Acme Inc
profiles.summary: This profile collects all compliance and security related requirements for Acme Inc.

controls.title: client: Check ssh_config owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The ssh_config should owned by root, only be writable by owner and readable to all.

controls.title: Client: Specify the AddressFamily to your need
controls.desc: OpenSSH should be configured to the network family. Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it to inet6.

controls.title: Client: Specify expected ssh port
controls.desc: Always specify which port the SSH client should connect. Prevent unexpected settings.

controls.title: Client: Specify protocol version 2
controls.desc: Only SSH protocol version 2 connections should be permitted. Version 1 of the protocol contains security vulnerabilities. Don't use legacy insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.

controls.title: Client: Disable batch mode
controls.desc: Avoid batch mode in the default configuration.

controls.title: Client: Check Host IPs
controls.desc: Make sure that SSH checks the host IP address in the known_hosts file, to avoid DNS spoofing effects.

controls.title: Client: Ask when checking host keys
controls.desc: Don't automatically add new hosts keys to the list of known hosts.

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh ciphers
controls.desc: Configure a list of ciphers to the best secure ciphers (avoid older and weaker ciphers)

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh Key-Exchange Algorithm
controls.desc: Configure a list of Key-Exchange Algorithms (Kexs) to the best secure Kexs (avoid older and weaker Key-Exchange Algorithm)

controls.title: Client: Check for secure ssh Message Authentication Codes
controls.desc: Configure a list of Message Authentication Codes (MACs) to the best secure MACs (avoid older and weaker Message Authentication Codes)

controls.title: Client: Disable agent forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent agent forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Client: Disable X11Forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent X11 forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Client: Disable HostbasedAuthentication
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Client: Disable rhosts-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid rhosts-based authentication, as it opens more ways for an attacker to enter a system.

controls.title: Client: Enable RSA authentication
controls.desc: Make sure RSA authentication is used by default.

controls.title: Client: Disable password-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid password-based authentications.

controls.title: Client: Disable GSSAPIAuthentication
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Client: Disable GSSAPIDelegateCredentials
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Client: Disable tunnels
controls.desc: Avoid using SSH tunnels.

controls.title: Client: Do not permit local commands
controls.desc: Do not permit any local command execution.

controls.title: Client: Do not allow Roaming
controls.desc: Workaround for SSH Client Bug CVE-2016-0777 and CVE-2016-0778

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh ciphers
controls.desc: Configure a list of ciphers to the best secure ciphers (avoid older and weaker ciphers)

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh Key-Exchange Algorithm
controls.desc: Configure a list of Key-Exchange Algorithms (Kexs) to the best secure Kexs (avoid older and weaker Key-Exchange Algorithm)

controls.title: Server: Check for secure ssh Message Authentication Codes
controls.desc: Configure a list of Message Authentication Codes (MACs) to the best secure MACs (avoid older and weaker Message Authentication Codes)

controls.title: Server: Check SSH folder owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The SSH folder should owned by root, only be writable by owner and readable by others.

controls.title: Server: Check sshd_config owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The sshd_config should owned by root, only be writable/readable by owner and not be executable.

controls.title: Server: Do not permit root-based login or do not allow password and keyboard-interactive authentication
controls.desc: Reduce the potential risk to gain full privileges access of the system because of weak password and keyboard-interactive authentication, do not allow logging in as the root user or with password authentication.

controls.title: Server: Specify the listen ssh Port
controls.desc: Always specify which port the SSH server should listen to. Prevent unexpected settings.

controls.title: Server: Specify the AddressFamily to your need
controls.desc: OpenSSH should be configured to the network family. Set it to inet if you use IPv4 only. For IPv6 only set it to inet6.

controls.title: Server: Specify ListenAddress
controls.desc: Limit the SSH server to listen to a specific address. Don't let it listen on all interfaces to avoid logins from unexpected sources.

controls.title: Server: Specify protocol version 2
controls.desc: Only SSH protocol version 2 connections should be permitted. Version 1 of the protocol contains security vulnerabilities. Don't use legacy insecure SSHv1 connections anymore.

controls.title: Server: Enable StrictModes
controls.desc: Prevent the use of insecure home directory and key file permissions.

controls.title: Server: Specify SyslogFacility to AUTH
controls.desc: Logging should be set to go to the /var/log/auth.log facility by using the SysLog AUTH parameter. This will ensure that any problems around invalid logins or the like are forwarded to a central security file for auditing purposes

controls.title: Server: Specify LogLevel to VERBOSE
controls.desc: Be verbose in logging, to allow analysis in case of unexpected behavior.

controls.title: Server: Specify SSH HostKeys
controls.desc: Specify HostKey for protection against Man-In-The-Middle Attacks

controls.title: Server: Specify UseLogin to NO
controls.desc: Disable legacy login mechanism and do not use login for interactive login sessions.

controls.title: Server: Use privilege separation
controls.desc: UsePrivilegeSeparation is an option, when enabled will allow the OpenSSH server to run a small (necessary) amount of code as root and the of the code in a chroot jail environment. This enables ssh to deal incoming network traffic in an unprivileged child process to avoid privilege escalation by an attacker.

controls.title: Server: Disable PermitUserEnvironment
controls.desc: Enabling environment processing may enable users to bypass access restrictions in some configurations using mechanisms such as LD_PRELOAD.

controls.title: Server: Specify LoginGraceTime
controls.desc: The LoginGraceTime gives the user 30 seconds to accomplish a login. This could be used to conduct a Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Specify Limit for maximum authentication retries
controls.desc: MaxAuthTries limits the user to three wrong attempts before the login attempt is denied. This avoid resource starvation attacks.

controls.title: Server: Specify maximum sessions
controls.desc: Specifies the maximum number of open sessions permitted per network connection. This could be used to conduct a Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Specify maximum startups
controls.desc: Limit the number of concurrent unauthenticated sessions to prevent Denial of Service (DoS) against a running SSH daemon.

controls.title: Server: Enable PubkeyAuthentication
controls.desc: Prefer public key authentication mechanisms, because other methods are weaker (e.g. passwords).

controls.title: Server: Disable IgnoreRhosts
controls.desc: Ignore legacy .rhosts configuration, because rhosts are a weak way to authenticate systems and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Enable IgnoreUserKnownHosts
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Disable HostbasedAuthentication
controls.desc: This option is a weak way for authentication and provide attacker more ways to enter the system.

controls.title: Server: Disable password-based authentication
controls.desc: Avoid password-based authentications.

controls.title: Server: Disable PermitEmptyPasswords
controls.desc: Accounts should be protected and users should be accountable. For this reason the usage of empty passwords should never be allowed.

controls.title: Server: Disable ChallengeResponseAuthentication
controls.desc: Avoid challenge-response and password-based authentications.

controls.title: Server: Disable Kerberos
controls.desc: Avoid kerberos authentication.

controls.title: Server: Disable Kerberos or Local Password
controls.desc: Avoid kerberos authentication because it use password-based authentication as fallback.

controls.title: Server: Enable KerberosTicketCleanup
controls.desc: Specifies whether to automatically destroy the user's ticket cache file on logout.

controls.title: Server: Disable GSSAPIAuthentication
controls.desc: If you do not use GSSAPI authentication then disable it.

controls.title: Server: Enable GSSAPICleanupCredentials
controls.desc: Automatically destroy the user's credentials cache on logout.

controls.title: Server: Disable TCPKeepAlive
controls.desc: Avoid the TCPKeepAlive messages to see if the client is still alive, because they are sent over unencrypted connection and are spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Set a client alive interval
controls.desc: ClientAlive messages are sent over encrypted connection and are not spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Configure a few client alive counters
controls.desc: This indicates the total number of checkalive message sent by the ssh server without getting any response from the ssh client. ClientAlive messages are sent over encrypted connection and are not spoofable.

controls.title: Server: Disable tunnels
controls.desc: Avoid to use tunnels.

controls.title: Server: Disable TCP forwarding
controls.desc: If you use TCP forwarding in an uncontrolled manner then you can bypass the firewalls

controls.title: Server: Disable Agent forwarding
controls.desc: Users with the ability to bypass file permissions on the remote host (for the agent's UNIX-domain socket) can access the local agent through the forwarded connection. An attacker cannot obtain key material from the agent, however they can perform operations on the keys that enable them to authenticate using the identities loaded into the agent.

controls.title: Server: Disable gateway ports
controls.desc: Prevent remote hosts from connecting to forwarded ports on the node.

controls.title: Server: Disable X11Forwarding
controls.desc: Prevent X11 forwarding by default, as it can be used in a limited way to enable attacks.

controls.title: Server: Enable X11UseLocalhost
controls.desc: SSH daemon should bind the X11 forwarding server to the loopback address. This prevents remote hosts from connecting to the proxy display and reduce the attack surface

controls.title: Server: Disable PrintMotd
controls.desc: This specifies that the SSH daemon itself should not read and display the message of the day file.

controls.title: Server: PrintLastLog
controls.desc: This tells the SSH daemon to print out information about the last time you logged in.

controls.title: Server: Banner
controls.desc: Specifies a banner file to serve before authentication succeeds

controls.title: Server: DebianBanner
controls.desc: Specifies whether to include OS distribution in version information

controls.title: Server: DH primes
controls.desc: Verifies if strong DH primes are used in /etc/ssh/moduli

controls.title: Apache should be running
controls.desc: Apache should be running.

controls.title: Apache should be enabled
controls.desc: Configure apache service to be automatically started at boot time

controls.title: Apache should start max. 1 root-task
controls.desc: The Apache service in its own non-privileged account. If the web server process runs with administrative privileges, an attack who obtains control over the apache process may control the entire system.

controls.title: Check Apache config folder owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The Apache config folder should owned and grouped by root, be writable, readable and executable by owner. It should be readable, executable by group and not readable, not writeable by others.

controls.title: Check Apache config file owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The Apache config file should owned and grouped by root, only be writable and readable by owner and not write- and readable by others.

controls.title: User and group should be set properly
controls.desc: For security reasons it is recommended to run Apache in its own non-privileged account.

controls.title: Set the apache server token
controls.desc: 'ServerTokens Prod' tells Apache to return only Apache as product in the server response header on the every page request

controls.title: Should not load certain modules
controls.desc: Apache HTTP should not load legacy modules

controls.title: Disable TRACE-methods
controls.desc: The web server doesnt allow TRACE request and help in blocking Cross Site Tracing attack.

controls.title: Disable insecure HTTP-methods
controls.desc: Disable insecure HTTP-methods and allow only necessary methods.

controls.title: Disable Apaches follows Symbolic Links for directories in alias.conf
controls.desc: Should include -FollowSymLinks or +SymLinksIfOwnerMatch for directories in alias.conf

controls.title: Disable Directory Listing for directories in alias.conf
controls.desc: Should include -Indexes for directories in alias.conf

controls.title: SSL honor cipher order
controls.desc: When choosing a cipher during an SSLv3 or TLSv1 handshake, normally the client's preference is used. If this directive is enabled, the server's preference will be used instead.

controls.title: Enable Apache Logging
controls.desc: Apache allows you to logging independently of your OS logging. It is wise to enable Apache logging, because it provides more information, such as the commands entered by users that have interacted with your Web server.

controls.title: client: Check ssh_config owner, group and permissions.
controls.desc: The ssh_config should owned by root, only be writable by owner and readable to all.

controls.title: Apache should start max. 1 root-task
controls.desc: The Apache service in its own non-privileged account. If the web server process runs with administrative privileges, an attack who obtains control over the apache process may control the entire system.
controls.code:
control 'apache-03' do
  title 'Apache should start max. 1 root-task'
  desc 'The Apache service in its own non-privileged account. If the web server process runs with administrative privileges, an attack who obtains control over the apache process may control the entire system.'
  total_tasks = command("ps aux | grep #{apache.service} | grep -v grep | grep root | wc -l | tr -d [:space:]").stdout.to_i
  describe total_tasks do
    it { should eq 1 }
  end
end

  title 'User and group should be set properly'
  desc 'For security reasons it is recommended to run Apache in its own non-privileged account.'
  describe apache_conf do
    its('User') { should eq [apache.user] }
    its('Group') { should eq [apache.user] }
  end
end

controls.title: SSL honor cipher order
controls.desc: When choosing a cipher during an SSLv3 or TLSv1 handshake, normally the client's preference is used. If this directive is enabled, the server's preference will be used instead.
controls.code:
control 'apache-13' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'SSL honor cipher order'
  desc 'When choosing a cipher during an SSLv3 or TLSv1 handshake, normally the client\'s preference is used. If this directive is enabled, the server\'s preference will be used instead.'

  describe file(File.join(apache.conf_dir, '/mods-enabled/ssl.conf')) do
    its('content') { should match(/^\s*?SSLHonorCipherOrder\s+?On/i) }
  end

  sites_enabled_path = File.join(apache.conf_dir, '/sites-enabled/')
  loaded_sites = command('ls ' << sites_enabled_path).stdout.split.keep_if { |file_name| /.conf/.match(file_name) }

  loaded_sites.each do |id|
    virtual_host = file(File.join(sites_enabled_path, id)).content.gsub(/#.*$/, '').scan(%r{<virtualhost.*443(.*?)<\/virtualhost>}im).flatten
    next if virtual_host.empty?
    describe virtual_host do
      it { should include(/^\s*?SSLHonorCipherOrder\s+?On/i) }
    end
  end
end

controls.title: Enable Apache Logging
controls.desc: Apache allows you to logging independently of your OS logging. It is wise to enable Apache logging, because it provides more information, such as the commands entered by users that have interacted with your Web server.
controls.code:
control 'apache-14' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Enable Apache Logging'
  desc 'Apache allows you to logging independently of your OS logging. It is wise to enable Apache logging, because it provides more information, such as the commands entered by users that have interacted with your Web server.'

  sites_enabled_path = File.join(apache.conf_dir, '/sites-enabled/')
  loaded_sites = command('ls ' << sites_enabled_path).stdout.split.keep_if { |file_name| /.conf/.match(file_name) }

  loaded_sites.each do |id|
    describe file(File.join(sites_enabled_path, id)).content.gsub(/#.*$/, '').scan(%r{<virtualhost(.*?)<\/virtualhost>}im).flatten do
      it { should include(/CustomLog.*$/i) }
    end
  end
end
